parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Allow or prevent an object being damaged (or injured, or killed). Alias of [[allowDamage]].<br>
The command does not prevent object from taking scripted damage such as [[setDamage]] or [[setHit]].<br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature </title><part><name index="1"/><value> important </value></part><part><name index="2"/><value> Command has to be executed where object is [[local]] and as long as object does not change locality the effect of this command will be global.
If object changes locality, the command needs to be executed again on the new [[owner]]'s machine to maintain the effect.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object [[allowDammage]] allow

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> allow: [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[allowDammage]] [[false]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setDammage]], [[getDammage]] [[allowDamage]] [[damage]] [[setDamage]]
</value></part></template>
